Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hup! [throws cheese puff to Ryan who catches it in his mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Things are a little slow here. And there's only so much cold-calling you can do in a day. Turns out there's no limit to the number of cheese puffs you can throw at someone's face.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hup! [throws cheese puff to Pam who catches it in her mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're getting pretty good at it.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pam and Ryan throw cheese puffs to Michael, Ryan and Michael throw cheese puffs at each other, Michael throws a cheese puff over his shoulder to Ryan, all three throw cheese puffs to one another, give high-fives]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pam yawns, two cheese puffs thrown at her, one sticks in her hair]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy put down a bunch of deposits on stuff for his wedding with Angela, but then she was sleeping with Dwight for... several years. Wait, no, that can't be right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The timeline's messy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Anyway, now we are going bargain hunting in the haunted graveyard of their love.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is my solo. [stereo plays Andy imitating bass guitar, a cappella starts singing 'You Can Call Me Al']

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm confused. Am I walking down the aisle to 'You Can Call Me Al?'

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Trust me. You will not be walking. You will be boogie-ing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am extremely interested. So, how much will all of this cost?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, 12 guys, airfare, three nights in a hotel, food per diem, table up front for merch... $9,000.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know. It seems like a lot for an a cappella group from a college we never went to.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you even hear the music I just played for you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: These sleeves are cutting off my circulation. Not enough blood getting to my hands.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think you look nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Doesn't Charles know he's compromising my attack readiness? It's not a dress code. It's a death sentence.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Looking good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: 'Kay, thank you. It's a straight jacket! [knocks things off shelf with arms] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When Michael was in charge, this place was like the Roman Empire. And the Wild West. And war-torn Poland. And Poland. There was just a lot going on, so what you wore to work was the least of anybody's worries. And in that chaos, I soared.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Ed's Tires is thinking of making a change.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [gestures to 'Bed & Breakfast' magazine] Is this good?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They have some great kitchen ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Okay. Ed's Tires, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's small, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I really appreciate it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks, Michael. [Michael palms Dwight cash in their handshake] Wait, what is this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's for your trouble.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wh- I don't need $6 to help a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, listen, as a friend, I want you to have this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, you know I can't take this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But don't forget you owe me $10.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was four years ago. Why don't you let it go?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What was up with Pam being all pushy and negative in there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think she just didn't want a crucifix cake.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It scares me to see you going down a road that I went down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Am I going down a road?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: When I see her bossing you around like that, it just makes me wonder if this thing really has the legs to go the distance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's so scary how right the things you're saying are. And you're coming at it with almost no knowledge, so of course I trust your opinion on this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know a few things about love. Horrible, terrible, awful, awful things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was going to use today to purge my inbox, but now something much more pressing has come up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ed's Tires. Why don't you tell them that we have fewer clients, so we can spend more time with each of them. Also, try to discuss it over Indian food, and try to mention how you distrust women.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is smart. That would not seem genuine. Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can get there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, you take the lead on this one. Also, do not forget that he has just gone through a messy divorce.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bring it in. Morning cheer. [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Michael, Pam & Ryan
Quote.Text: U-G-L-Y, you ain't got no alibi! You ugly, huh huh, you ugly! You mama says you ugly! Hey! Go Michael Scott Paper Company!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm here. I'm a part of this now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You needed to speak to me?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Dwight, take a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I prefer to stand. Less blood clots.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Nah, that's weird. You're gonna sit. [Dwight sits] Great. You know, Dwight, it has been quite a transition for all of us. Are you happy with the way things have been runnin' lately?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you mean compared to the ways things ran with other bosses? Comparisons are hard.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I've just been impressed with your performance and I wanted to make sure good work doesn't go unnoticed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your concern is noted.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yeah, I like your work ethic. You're so... focused.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like a wolf. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: And I wanna start givin' you more responsibility. What do you say you and I go out for a drink this week?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] It's firm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] I need you to get me the prices that you're charging Ed's tires so I can undercut Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know that I can do that now. You know, uh, something's come up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh n- Is it Mose? Did you put the cover on that well?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Mose is fine. I roped it off. It's not about Mose. Listen, things are changing here, Michael, they're changing fast.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not following you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Imagine... Someone has a personal hero they really wanna help. But then there's this new guy. Very cool, very Will Smith-esque, who would not like it if he helped his hero.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Personal hero, cool new guy. Okay, I think I'm getting your drift.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good, do you see what I'm saying?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Crystal clear. So is this for a movie that you're writing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can I use it? [Pam holds up note saying "He's talking about you!"]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael dismisses note, Ryan and Pam point to notepad] Dwight, are you talking about us?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is possible that I could be talking about us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Someone could say that it is like the situation that we are in now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is the situation that we are in now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I would say that the old boss has always been good to Dwight, and he was there first, so he has dibs. You respect dibs, don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not a barbarian.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Will you meet me in 20 minutes at the spot?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is the cool new guy Charles?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've said too much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy. You know I've been thinkin about what you said-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: 'Noishe.'

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: -I just don't know if I can do it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's interesting, because I hear what you're saying is that you want to do it, which means you can do it. Believe me, I broke up with Angela, and I'm like, the happiest guy ever. I mean, I'm so happy. I'm so happy. Like, total freedom, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's just that Pam gets me through the day, you know? I really rely on her. I'm pretty emotionally needy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And you know what? I am here for you. Let me be your traveling pants. [imitates punching on Jim's fist] Ah, what'd you do that for?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [both laugh] You know that I was doin' this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [fist pound each other] Totally.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Dwight. What's with the shirt? Are you alright?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, Michael

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: [Charles comes from around corner] Hi, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God! Run! Run! It's a setup. Setup!

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: No, Mich-Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, run!

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Michael, no, let's be cool, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You be cool.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just-what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: We need to talk about our two companies, and how we should behave. Dwight tells me you've been pestering him for company info.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-do... Dwight would not-

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: He did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I did, Michael. I was upset about the shirt sleeves at first, but now I'm okay with it.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Michael, I want you to stop pestering my salesmen, and I want you to leave Dunder Mifflin alone. Do you understand?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I. Understand. Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael storms into office] Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, are you alright?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was a setup. Dwight told Charles. He told him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tell us what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's like, a girl says she'll make out with you, but then her boyfriend is waiting around the corner with a pee-filled balloon.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We can't help you if you don't just tell us what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got hit in the face with a pee-filled water balloon, Pam, ok? I don't know how they did it. They filled the balloon with pee. A funnel? I don't know. Is that clear enough for you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim slams lunchbag on table] I just totally blew a sales call.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Bro, I do that all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, with you it's different, okay? Cause I just- I just suck. I just- I suck!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna, be nice to my friend Jim, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why? When I look in the mirror, I don't like the face that looks back.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, so what? Your body's a ten.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Forget it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I said forget it. [drop kicks lunch across room, stomps on it]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, traitor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think you have the wrong number, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to listen to me, friend, and I want you to listen to me good. I am going to come at you, and I am going to come at you hard. I am going to steal all of your clients, and then I am going to kill them in front of you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just getting hardcore with him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Finally.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, and hear me, Dwight, when I say I brought you into this world, and I can take you out. [hangs up] Bill Cosby.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] Mr. Schofield, please?

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: He's in a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dammit! [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Is Mr. Schofield there?

Quote.Speaker: Automated phone voice
Quote.Text: If you'd like to reach an outside line, please dial nine first. [Michael sighs, hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So, you think Michael's going after the whale, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have a long term relationship with Harper Collins publishers and Mr. Schofield. I'm not worried.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You sound worried.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you have bad skin. Oh, look everyone, we're all making observations! [gibberish sounds]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Well, if you could do me a big favor and tell Mr. Schofield that Michael Scott has tickets to the Wilkes-Barre Penguins game this weekend, and if he would like to join me... Hello, Daniel. How are you? Uh-huh. I sure do. Yes. [referencing rolodex card] Wanted to ask, did Kathy ever make JV?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look at that old dude and his rolodex go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I spent a month putting that rolodex on his Blackberry, which he now uses as a nightlight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. High score?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And no, I cannot lower my current prices. [phone rings] Hold on. Hello? Mr. Schofield, thank you so much for taking the time to talk. I wanted to discuss your contract with us- oh, you're considering him. I thought Michael Scott left the paper business after his nervous breakdown.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael has been talking to my biggest client. Master and apprentice pitted against one another for the fate of the greater Scranton area paper market. So it's not exactly like 'Highlander,' but still...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Dwight, I've been expecting your call. What do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would like to arrange a truce.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you heard Schofield is considering a switch, and you want mercy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Meet me in our spot in four minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. You think I am going to fall for that? There's no-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meet- Ok, go to the spot and then walk 100 feet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In which direction?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toward the sun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: At what time?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Noon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have two seconds. [Dwight starts running]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looking at his watch] Michael. [Madge walks by] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hope you're not recording this conversation. [Dwight drops his pants and lifts up his shirt] Good. I cannot believe that you sided with Charles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You were making me do things that were not all right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you just rat me out? You could have said no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And not come through for you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you want a truce, I will give you a truce.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want a truce.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me take you and your whole company out for lunch at Alfredo's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cooper's.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had fish yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael, Ryan and Pam sitting at restaurant, phone rings] Oh. Dwight-elicious. Where you at?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, hi, Michael. I'm so sorry I'm late. I got stuck in traffic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? That's weird. We didn't see any.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I hit a bear.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's technically fine. I imagine the true horror will be when he wakes up in a zoo. [throws a fish into the vent at Michael's office] Hey, listen, will you do me a favor and order the meatball parm for me, with extra cheese?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, I will see you very soon, alright? [takes all the items off Michael's desk and puts them into briefcase, including rolodex]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, see you in a bit. Dwight hit a bear. He'll be here in a sec.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam, Ryan and Michael enter office] Sounds neat.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We can spend a couple days there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, I think we've been robbed!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael answers phone] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you enjoy your lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, not now, we've been robbed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Michael, you were sabotaged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Dwight, we were robbed. How would you even know? You're still stuck in traffic. [Pam holds up sign saying "Dwight did it!!"] You?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about our truce?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I broke it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On purpose?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You think this is some kind of game? No, this is a war, and I will not stop, I will not rest. You have no idea what kind of enemy you've created. You have unleashed the wolf!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Be that as it may, I have your meatball parm sandwich here, and I am going to eat it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I knew that you would do that. The meatball parm is their worst sandwich!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. [bites into sandwich, looks disgusted] Bastard!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi there. Dwight Schrute here. I was just calling to see if Michael Scott Paper was meeting all of your paper needs, and how is [reading off rolodex card] Brenda, age four, ponytail, and Simon, age 7? Oh, you don't say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [holding up rolodex card] Schrute comma Dwight. And on the back he wrote, "great salesman, better friend." [turns card over] "Tall" and "beets."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And say hello to Cheri, who is your black wife. [hangs up and answers cell phone] I see you're begging for mercy, huh? Well, you will find none here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, do you mind if we talk?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure. That'd be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you keep coming after us, the Michael Scott Paper Company cannot succeed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is war and that is what happens.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, one more thing. I'm going to have you listen while I steal your biggest client.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no. No. No. No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, uh oh, I'm turning you down right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael! Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can hear me, but I can't hear you.

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: Mr. Schofield's ready to see you now, Mr. Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, great. Mr. Schofield's ready to see me. Thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't let him in! He's a traitor! Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Walking in the door...

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Schofield
Quote.Text: Michael, good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mr. Schofield, good to see you. And I'm closing the door. [Dwight runs out of the office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone in Dwight's car] Now, when Dwight tells you that he will keep prices steady for a year, I think he is speaking out of turn.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Schofield
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. He does not have the authority to say that. I, on the other hand, am the president, the owner, and the founder. It is like you are buying software from Bill Gates.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you saying you invented paper?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [hugging a crying Jim] Okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, Tuna.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hey, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Excuse me, can I have your attention, everyone? Here's the deal, everybody, Jim Halpert is very upset and disturbed. I don't know if it was something you did, something you said, a look you gave him, maybe it was nothing at all, but here's the deal, ok? It stops now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I guess I could be nicer.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy, I think Jim is messing with you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, really?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. [looks over to Jim smiling through windows to the kitchen]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, okay, what the heck is happennin' here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Two things I need you to understand. One, Pam and I are very happy together.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, that's not what was-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And two, that stuff that happened with you and Angela is a bummer, and I know you don't think you're ever gonna find someone else, but you will. I promise you, you will.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh man, he got me so good. I learned something about myself today. Yeah. I wish this was a sofa, cause I feel like I could sit here and talk for hours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is that thing that Dwight always says? Paper is the soil in which the seeds of business grow?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not the soil! It's the manure! Paper is the manure! On-time delivery is the soil! Aah! [runs into office]

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: Uh, hello, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Spin move.

Quote.Speaker: Secretary
Quote.Text: Oh-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha ha! April 13th, 2002.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Schofield
Quote.Text: Dwight, I'm in a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's very rude.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I barge because I care. April 13th, 2002, that is the date when you tried to switch paper providers for an obscure sociology textbook, but were hung out to dry when the price of glossy stock increased.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Schofield
Quote.Text: Maybe we should schedule a meeting on our-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: La la la! Continuing. Notice my persistence and recall. Continuing! You called Dunder Mifflin, and your order was filled within an hour!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to pull a date out of the air right now. April 13th, 2002. That is the last day that you evaluated your paper needs. Is it not? We all know that the economy is bad, and bloated companies like Dunder Mifflin...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are going to fall by the wayside. Two of their branches have closed within the last year. The Michael Scott Paper Company, however, has opened a new branch this very month.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What he's not telling you is that he will abandon you.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Schofield
Quote.Text: Why don't you guys just e-mail me your best offers and we can finish it up that way?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That sounds like a fantastic idea. I will see you this weekend for the Penguins. Box seats as usual.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Schofield
Quote.Text: Uh, ok, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, good, good. I will see you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Mr. Schofield, for your time. Much appreciated. Oh, and tell me, um, how's your gay son?

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Schofield
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I color code all my info. I wrote "gay son" in green. Green means go, so I know to go ahead and shut up about it. Orange means "Orange you glad you didn't bring it up?" Most colors mean "Don't say it."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How is Tom, the homosexual sophomore?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wanted to start a company, not a war. Because in a war, you always fight those you are closest to. And the great tragedy of the civil war is that brother fought against brother. For what? What purpose did that serve? Apart from abolishing slavery? In that case, war was the right choice. This doesn't feel as important though. That's just how the world works, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [muffled speech, Ryan, Michael, and Pam all have mouths stuffed with cheese puffs, Michael answers the phone and talks with mouth full]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He gives me leads and I take the leads from him and in exchange it makes him feel good. And if a friend can't make you feel good, then I don't want any friends. Except Dwight, because he is our only source of fertile leads.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight just got Howard Family Dry Cleaners.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uncle Dave?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's undercutting us big time. He's actually taking a loss and paying the difference out of pocket.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's my family. When you mess with my family, I can't be responsible for my actions.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When are you ever responsible for your actions?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Get off my ass, you hag.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey. Something about that seems inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Betrayal ain't just a river in Egypt.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who is that knocking on my taste buds? Why, it's Mr. Lemon. Hmmm, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's good. But won't it feel weird cutting into a cross?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't think of it as a cross in the Judeo-Christian sense, think of it more as a symbol of your lives crossing in marriage.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When I think of it like that, I do not think of the other connotations.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think so, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry. Her day.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, bud.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are they looking at me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Everyone. Everyone just keeps looking at me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Will you just talk to them, please? Pam just knew!
